snippet: Critics are saying the updated regulations would keep chicken-processing lines running too fast, creating conditions for worker injuries and food-safety failures.
abstract: Agriculture Dept releases long-awaited poultry-inspection rules that will give plant operators the option of conducting their own inspections for bird defects and feces on the processing lines and allow government inspectors to concentrate on other food issues in the plant.
lead_paragraph: Critics are saying the updated regulations would keep chicken-processing lines running too fast, creating conditions for worker injuries and food-safety failures.

headline.main: New Rules Say Poultry Plants Can Conduct Own Checks
headline.print_headline: New Rules Say Poultry Plants Can Conduct Own Checks

keywords.value: American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals
keywords.name: organizations
